newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Italy considers swapping Russian debt for shares.
newsitem.headline: Italy considers swapping Russian debt for shares.

text.p: Italian Foreign Trade Minister Augusto Fantozzi said Thursday that Italy was considering swapping some of Moscow's debt to Rome for shares in newly privatised Russian companies.
Fantozzi told a news conference that Italy could trade about one-third of Russia's $14 billion debt, stemming from the Soviet era, for equity.
"Currently we are considering Russian legislation and looking into how this system can be implemented," he said.
Russia's $14 billion debt to Italy represents $8 billion in sovereign debt, $5 billion owed to commercial banks and $500 million in commercial non-guaranteed debt.

Fantozzi said that the idea first arose at a meeting of the Russian-Italian Committee for Trade and Economic Cooperation last month. Two-thirds of Russia's debt to Italy was restructured earlier this year, he said.
